com.beaglebuddy.mpeg

Class MPEGFrameHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.mpeg.MPEGFrameHeader

  • public class MPEGFrameHeader
extends java.lang.Object

    The audio portion of an .mp3 file is stored in MPEG audio frames as shown below. Each MPEG audio frame begins with an MPEG frame header. The header has a fixed length of 4 bytes, and optionally contains a 2 byte CRC directly following it, before the side information.

    See Also:
    ISO / IEC 11172-3, MPEG Audio Frame Header, MPEG Basics, MPEG Audio Layer I/II/III frame header

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FRAME_HEADER_SIZE
      mpeg audio frame headers are 4 bytes (32 bits) in length

        public static final int FRAME_HEADER_SIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • MPEGFrameHeader

        public MPEGFrameHeader()
        default constructor.

      • MPEGFrameHeader

        public MPEGFrameHeader(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ParseException
        constructor used for parsing existing .mp3 files. This constructor is called when reading in an existing mpeg frame header from an .mp3 file. It parses the raw binary data of the mpeg frame header and stores the values in the corresponding data members.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream to read in the mpeg audio frame from the binary .mp3 file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the mpeg frame header.
        ParseException - if an invalid value is detected while parsing the mpeg frame header's raw bytes.
        See Also:
        MPEG Audio Frame Header, The Anatomy of an MP3 File

      • MPEGFrameHeader

        public MPEGFrameHeader(byte[] bytes,
                       java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ParseException
        constructor used for parsing existing .mp3 files. This constructor is called when searching for the 1st mpeg audio frame header from an .mp3 file or when re-synching the audio stream. It parses the raw binary data of the mpeg frame header and stores the values in the corresponding data members.
        Parameters:
        bytes - bytes read in from the previous attempt to find the mpeg frame header.
        inputStream - input stream to read in the mpeg audio frame CRC from the binary .mp3 file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the mpeg frame header.
        ParseException - if an invalid value is detected while parsing the mpeg frame header's raw bytes.
        See Also:
        MPEG Audio Frame Header, The Anatomy of an MP3 File

      • getBitrate

        public int getBitrate()
        gets the bit rate (in kilobits per second - kbps), which specifies how many kb are used to represent the audio data for each second of playback.
        Returns:
        the bite rate in kbit/s for this .mpeg audio frame. A value of 0 means free format, while a value of -1 means an invalid value. All other values are actual valid bit rates.

      • getFrequency

        public int getFrequency()
        gets the frequency (in herz - hz), which specifies how many times per second the audio is sampled and stored as a number in the .mp3 file. CD audio is sampled at 44.1 khz, which means 44,100 samples per second.
        Returns:
        the sampling frequency (in hz) used to convert the analog audio to a digital .mp3 file. A value of -1 indicates an invalid value due to the MPEG version

      • getChannelMode

        public ChannelMode getChannelMode()
        gets the channel mode (mono or stereo) of this .mp3 file.
        Returns:
        the channel mode (mono or stereo) of this .mp3 file.
